title: Introduction / Motivation
description: Sets the context for the research.

title: Theoretical Framework
description: Outlines conceptual models, key theories, or philosophical assumptions that form the basis of the study. Focuses on explaining the lens or framework used for analysis, not summarizing past studies.

title: Literature Review/Reanalysis
description: Synthesizes previous empirical or theoretical studies, evaluating their findings, gaps, and contributions. May include reanalysis of existing datasets or replication of prior results.

title: Methods
description: Details study procedures: participants, instruments, data collection and analysis techniques. May include ethical considerations. Also describes specific materials, tools or activities used in the study (e.g., instructional sequences, software, protocols).

title: Results
description: Objective findings (tables, figures, statistics) without further interpretation.

title: Discussion
description: Interprets results, compares to prior work, and discusses limitations. May be combined with Results in some papers.

title: Implications
description: Practical or theoretical consequences for stakeholders (policymakers, educators, etc.), including future development directions.

title: Conclusion / Summary
description: Concise summary of findings and key takeaways, often with future research directions.

title: Limitations
description: Acknowledgment of study limitations, such as sample size, methodology, or generalizability.

title: Ethical Considerations
description: Discussion of ethical issues related to the research, such as consent, confidentiality, and potential biases.

title: Appendix / Supplementary Material
description: Additional information that supports the main text, such as detailed data, extended methods, or supplementary analyses.

title: Acknowledgments
description: Recognition of contributions from individuals or organizations not listed as authors.

title: References
description: List of works cited in the paper.
